qas.question: What do Samoans affectionately call their national rugby team?
The Samoan team hasn't missed a Rugby World Cup since what year?
What organization governs the Samoan rugby team?
What team that went on to become World Cup champions was almost bested by Manu Samoa in 2003?
In what year did Manu Samoa make it to the second round of the World Cup?
What is the national sport in England?
How long has England competed at every Rugby World Cup?

plausible_answers.text: in 1991, 1995 and the second round of the 1999 world cup

qas.question: How often did England make quarter finals?
When did England come close to beating Samoa?
What alliance has England been a member of since 1991?

context: <b5_0>Rugby union<b5_0/> is the national sport in Samoa and the national team, nicknamed the <a0_0>Manu Samoa<a0_0/>, is consistently competitive against teams from vastly more populous nations. Samoa has competed at every Rugby World Cup <b6_0>since <a1_0>1991<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and made the quarter finals <b7_0>in 1991, 1995 and the second round of the <a4_0>1999<a4_0/> world cup<b7_0/>. <b8_0>At the 2003 world cup<b8_0/>, Manu Samoa came close to beating eventual world champions, <a3_0>England<a3_0/>. Samoa also played in the Pacific Nations Cup and the <b9_0>Pacific Tri-Nations<b9_0/> The sport is governed by the <a2_0>Samoa Rugby Football Union<a2_0/>, who are members of the Pacific Islands Rugby Alliance, and thus, also contribute to the international Pacific Islanders rugby union team.
